definition: Timur or Tamerlane (1336-1405), Mongol emperor and conqueror
rubbing from incised inscription
invitation card/notice
fitting snugly/appropriate/suitable/variant of 貼|贴[tie1]/to paste/to obey
surname Mu
tree/wood/coffin/wooden/simple/numb/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
variant of 人[ren2]/"person" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 10), occurring in 兒, 兀, 兄 etc

Timur or Tamerlane (1336-1405), Mongol emperor and conqueror

sentences.english: Timur and the tearful Liù also beg him not to risk his life.
sentences.chinese: 帖木儿和柳儿亦含泪恳求他不要冒险。

sentences.english: Both Tamburlaine and Faustus are typical in possessing such a spirit.
sentences.chinese: 帖木儿和浮士德是具有这一精神的典型。

sentences.english: Calàf tries to convince the crowd that neither of them knows his secret.
sentences.chinese: 卡拉富试图说服人群帖木儿和柳儿并不知道他的姓名。

sentences.english: The wars occurred between Timur and Toqtamish could be studied through two different periods.
sentences.chinese: 帖木儿与钦察汗脱脱迷失之间的战争分为两个阶段。

sentences.english: He published his first volume of poetry called, Tamerlane and Other Poems.
sentences.chinese: 之后发表了第一首诗，名为《帖木儿及其他诗》。

definition: Yollig Taxin or Yelü Dashi (1087-1143), Chinese-educated Khitan leader, founder of Western Liao 西遼|西辽 in Central Asia
Khubilai Khan (1215-1294), grandson of Genghis Khan 成吉思汗, first Yuan dynasty emperor, reigned 1260-1294
Temujin, birth name of Genghis Khan 成吉思汗[Cheng2 ji2 si1 han2]
khanate (Mongol state)

Mongolia

Ögedei Khan (1186-1242), a son of Genghis Khan
Oirat Mongols (alliance of tribes of Western Mongolia) (Ming Dynasty term)
Mongol
Bayan (name)/Bayan of the Baarin (1236-1295), Mongol Yuan general under Khubilai Khan, victorious over the Southern Song 1235-1239/Bayan of the Merkid (-1340), Yuan dynasty general and politician
Tolui (1193-1232), fourth son of Genghis Khan
Chagatai (died 1241), a son of Genghis Khan

Genghis Khan (1162-1227), founder and ruler of the Mongol Empire
